title: Easy Roasted Broccoli Recipe
description: Roasted broccoli florets and broccoli stems are cooked with just olive oil, salt, and pepper. So much more flavorsome than boiled or steamed broccoli!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Broccoli Easy Roasted Broccoli 4.7 (175) 132 Reviews 27 Photos Roasted broccoli is easy to make and so much more flavorsome than boiled. My favorite part is the roasted sliced stem pieces. Submitted by karenatlincoln Updated on January 2, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 27 27 27 27 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 14 ounces broccoli 1 tablespoon olive oil salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cut broccoli florets from the stalk. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Peel the stalk and slice into 1/4-inch slices. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix florets and stem pieces with olive oil in a bowl and transfer to a baking sheet; season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast in the preheated oven until broccoli is tender and lightly browned, about 18 to 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Roasted Broccoli 01 of 27 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 27 Photo by  Brian 03/03/2025 A keeper! Delicious.Easy to make. 03 of 27 Photo by  MaryLou 12/16/2023 Such an easy, quick, and yummy recipe! My family enjoyed it. It is very versatile, the second time we made it we added cauliflower. Brussels sprouts would be great too. I love that this recipe really lets the broccoli shine. We'll be making it often. 04 of 27 Photo by  Sheila LaLonde 08/21/2023 It doesn't get much easier than this! Simple, yet tasty! Next time I will try using the air fryer to avoid heating up the kitchen. 05 of 27 Photo by  nicolekrystyn 08/19/2023 I usually just buy pre-cut broccoli florets but whole broccoli was on sale this weekend so I decided to try this. Very quick and easy to prep and the entire pan was gone after dinner! I'll definitely be buying more whole broccoli and preparing it this way from now on. The timing and temperature was perfect in my oven, but when I do smaller batches of broccoli in my air fryer I only need 6-8 minutes. 06 of 27 Photo by  bfarias 06/08/2021 07 of 27 Photo by  Bentley 04/20/2021 08 of 27 Photo by  ronduarte 05/07/2020 Great recipe! I actually added carrots, some sweet peppers and red onion. It was good!
